intro: Adenophaedra cearensis, commonly known as the Ceará adenophy, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are ovate with serrated edges, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Adenophaedra cearensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
